decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to aggressively use cheap spells and cantrips to quickly fill the graveyard with Arclight Phoenixes and trigger their ability to return them to the battlefield. It also aims to control the board with cheap removal spells like Lightning Bolt and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Remand and Gut Shot. The deck utilizes the synergy between instants and sorceries and the graveyard to generate powerful threats like Crackling Drake and Thing in the Ice. It aims to win the game quickly through efficient spells and powerful creatures.

The main concept of this Modern Valakut Combo deck is to ramp up mana quickly and efficiently, using cards like Search for Tomorrow and Farseek, to eventually cast Scapeshift and sacrifice multiple lands to deal lethal damage with Valakut triggers. Utilizing Primeval Titan to search for Valakut and Mountains accelerates the combo, while cards like Sakura-Tribe Scout and Khalni Heart Expedition help with land drops. Anger of the Gods provides board control, and Courser of Kruphix offers card advantage and life gain. The deck aims to win through a powerful, combo-driven win condition.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures to combo off using Prime Speaker Vannifar's ability to tutor for specific creatures. By utilizing cards like Eldritch Evolution and Chord of Calling, the deck can quickly find combo pieces such as Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Zealous Conscripts to create an infinite combo. This deck aims to be versatile with different creatures for various situations, while also being able to quickly assemble powerful combos to win the game. The key strategy is to find the right creatures at the right time to maximize the deck's potential.

The main focus of this Modern Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to quickly deal damage to the opponent with efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. By using cards like Lightning Bolt, Searing Blaze, and Lava Spike, along with speedy creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently before the opponent can stabilize. The deck also includes cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Grim Lavamancer to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain pressure on them. The deck prioritizes speed and direct damage to win the game as quickly as possible.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to play powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. It utilizes colorless lands and cost-reducing effects to cast big threats like Reality Smasher and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Dismember and board wipes like All Is Dust to control the battlefield. The combination of aggressive creatures and disruption makes this deck a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matchups.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key strategy involves using Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to generate card advantage and provide flexible answers to threats. Snapcaster Mage is used to recycle key spells from the graveyard, while Celestial Colonnade provides a win condition. The deck also includes land destruction in the form of Field of Ruin to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The goal is to outvalue the opponent, control the board, and win through incremental advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using low cost creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent from the beginning of the game with aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Bomat Courier. This is complemented by cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt to finish off the opponent. The deck also utilizes Eidolon of the Great Revel to punish the opponent for playing spells. The overall strategy is to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero.

This Golgari Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. Tarmogoyf provides a quick clock, while Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize strip away key cards from the opponent's hand. Removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy keep the board clear, allowing for aggressive attacks. Liliana of the Veil and other planeswalkers provide additional value and disruption. The deck utilizes a mix of creatures, lands, and spells to create a strong tempo advantage and push for victory quickly.

This UR Storm deck focuses on quickly generating mana and card advantage to cast multiple spells in a single turn, leading to a lethal combo finish with either Empty the Warrens or Grapeshot. By utilizing cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells, and rituals like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual to generate additional mana, the deck aims to chain together spells and increase storm count for a powerful finish. Gifts Ungiven is used to tutor for key combo pieces like Past in Flames and generate card advantage.

The deck revolves around assembling a combo with Vizier of Remedies and Devoted Druid to generate infinite mana. It uses Collected Company and Chord of Calling to tutor for combo pieces or toolbox creatures like Knight of Autumn and Eternal Witness. The deck also includes utility creatures like Kitchen Finks and Walking Ballista for resilience and versatility. It aims to control the board with disruptive creatures like Tidehollow Sculler and Shalai, Voice of Plenty while using Gavony Township to pump up its creatures. The deck's flexibility and ability to combo off quickly make it a strong contender in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly flood the board with a variety of aggressive Human creatures that can grow in power and overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls to cheat creatures into play and make them uncounterable, the deck can quickly establish early dominance. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and other disruptive creatures also hinder the opponent's ability to cast spells efficiently, while cards like Phantasmal Image and Reflector Mage provide versatility and disruption. The deck aims to deploy threats quickly and efficiently to beat down the opponent before they can respond effectively.

This deck focuses on using efficient removal and disruption alongside powerful creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. By combining hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, the deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's resources and close out the game. Cards like Liliana of the Veil and Bloodbraid Elf provide additional value and card advantage, while versatile removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Assassin's Trophy ensure that the deck can handle a variety of threats. The goal is to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan.
